definition.name: Setup .NET Core SDK
definition.description: Used to build and publish .NET source. Set up a specific version of the .NET and authentication to private NuGet repository
definition.author: GitHub

inputs.name: dotnet-version
inputs.description: Optional SDK version(s) to use. If not provided, will install global.json version when available. Examples: 2.2.104, 3.1, 3.1.x, 3.x, 6.0.2xx

inputs.name: dotnet-quality
inputs.description: Optional quality of the build. The possible values are: daily, signed, validated, preview, ga.

inputs.name: global-json-file
inputs.description: Optional global.json location, if your global.json isn't located in the root of the repo.

inputs.name: source-url
inputs.description: Optional package source for which to set up authentication. Will consult any existing NuGet.config in the root of the repo and provide a temporary NuGet.config using the NUGET_AUTH_TOKEN environment variable as a ClearTextPassword

inputs.name: owner
inputs.description: Optional OWNER for using packages from GitHub Package Registry organizations/users other than the current repository's owner. Only used if a GPR URL is also provided in source-url

inputs.name: config-file
inputs.description: Optional NuGet.config location, if your NuGet.config isn't located in the root of the repo.

inputs.name: cache
inputs.description: Optional input to enable caching of the NuGet global-packages folder

inputs.name: cache-dependency-path
inputs.description: Used to specify the path to a dependency file: packages.lock.json. Supports wildcards or a list of file names for caching multiple dependencies.

outputs.name: cache-hit
outputs.description: A boolean value to indicate if a cache was hit.

outputs.name: dotnet-version
outputs.description: Contains the installed by action .NET SDK version for reuse.
